body_html:
As a workaround, cloning pytorch, and then doing:

cd docs
git checkout tags/v0.4.1 requirements.txt source/conf.py
pip install -r requirements.txt
make html

gives warnings, but does generate a readable version of the current docs with the old theme in docs/build/html
body_text:
As a workaround, cloning pytorch, and then doing:
cd docs
git checkout tags/v0.4.1 requirements.txt source/conf.py
pip install -r requirements.txt
make html
gives warnings, but does generate a readable version of the current docs with the old theme in  docs/build/html
body:
As a workaround, cloning pytorch, and then doing:
```sh
cd docs
git checkout tags/v0.4.1 requirements.txt source/conf.py
pip install -r requirements.txt
make html
```
gives warnings, but does generate a readable version of the current docs with the old theme in  `docs/build/html`
